ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I am now comfortable constructing very basic sentences in Vietnamese and can have a short conversation on a variety of elementary-level topics.
Learned much of the culture through the learning the language of Vietnamese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course would be stronger if there were a greater focus on conversation. The textbook is much more vocabulary-based than it is dialogue-based; I think a focus on practical, everyday dialogues (and a stronger level of attention to tones and accurate pronunciation) would improve outcomes.

The strengths of the course is the size and the repetitiveness of the exercises, really drilling into you a new language. The openness of the instructor fostered a welcoming and supportive environment. The weaknesses of this course primarily dealt with organization -- from the textbook to the structure of the class. The textbook was not organized in a clear manner and thus made the class activities a little confusing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to students interested in learning Vietnamese, yes.

Such a fun class to take! Professor Quang is an excellent teacher and engages us with all sorts of material to ensure that we are developing good written, listening and speaking skills. The class also tends to be smaller in size, which means that each student gets a lot of attention.
It is a nice way to learn Vietnamese, however you feel at a disadvantage if you come completely without any knowledge of any of the cultural differences or language conceptions.
